content: dragonfly wings this simple wrap is knit in one piece from the top centre with two increases on every row and four increases on every sixth row these increases give a very wide shallow triangular shape that allows many ways to tie and drape this shawl without the need for a shawl pin though it is a wonderful excuse to treat yourself to one knit in fingering or sport weight yarn this is a very simple project even for a beginner lace knitter the main body of the shawl is stocking stitch with garter stitch ribs throughout the lace section is easily memorised and the reverse row of the lace pattern are all purled the addition of beads is optional requirements needles 4 5mm us7 5mm us8 5 5mm us9 6mm us10 yarn shown in multi-coloured shawls - fyberspates faery wings 350m/383yds blue shawl - madelinetosh tosh sock 361m/395yds or any fingering or sport weight yarn you will also need crochet hook size 1mm small enough to fit through the hole of size 5 miyuki triangular bead you will need about 275 stitch markers yarn needle and blocking pins gauge is not critical but your finished size/yardage requirements will vary abbreviations k knit p purl ktb knit through the back of the stitch kbf knit through the back of the stitch and then knit into the front making one extra stitch co cast on cotb cast on through the back of the stitch place the stitch on the left hand needle cs centre stitch m1l make one stitch by picking up the bar between the two stitches from the front using the left hand needle and knitting into the back of it m1r make one stitch by picking up the bar between the two stitches from the back using the left hand needle and knitting into the front of it yo yarn over ssk slip a stitch knit wise slip another knit wise transfer to left hand needle and knit together through the back k2tog knit 2 stitches together as one s2kpsso slip next 2 stitches together as to knit k1 pass 2 slipped stitches over 2 stitches decreased dragonfly wings v1 6 boo knits © 2011 further patterns available at www ravelry com/designers/boo-knits page 1 instructions all row where there are increases around the centre stitch are marked with a bold row title and the garter ridge row are in italics for ease of reading the edge stitches should not be too tight as the finished shawl should have a flat top or very slightly curved not puckered there should be a stitch marker either side of the centre stitch these will be slipped as you go with 4 5mm needles us7 cast on 3 stitches knit 7 row at the end of the last row do not turn work but rotate 90 degrees pick up and knit 3 stitches one in each garter ridge rotate 90 degrees clockwise again and knit three stitches in the cast on edge
